storyInfo: Bagpipe gets acquainted with Jane, who is preparing to return to the barracks, and Jane agrees to search for leads. Horn meets the colonel, and learns that the barracks have suffered grievous losses from Tarans' and the spectre force's attacks.

attributes.content: Ugh, took a peltin' and some. Missed Captain Kelly in the end.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Here, take this hankie, wipe yourself off, or else the smell of those rotten leaves'll stick to you.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Thank you!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Didn't imagine any of our soldiers apart from Captain Kelly would visit District Seventeen on their own.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Our soldiers? You mean like, you're one too?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Shh.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (Clears throat) I slipped out in secret. Can't do that in uniform.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You're not gonna make anyone happy taking a shortcut to the barracks through here in that getup.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Eh, really?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No wonder. I barely said anythin' before it was a bombardment of all gone-off leaves and fruit.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Are you a new transfer?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Kind of. I'm here from Londinium.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Well, Londinium! I've never been. Must be miles larger than County Hillock there...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Does The Shard really go three hundred floors up? Is there really a teleportation circle buried in the mound under the Royal Victorian Academy of Science, leading to the miraculous space where the first Draco King's Jewels are kept?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Eh... eh? Jewels? Never even heard of them.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But I do know what the high-speed terrestrial warships look like when they leave the factory, and I've seen the hydroponics workshop... If you wanna know anythin' of that sort, I could definitely tell you.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Warships? Hydroponics workshop...? Doesn't sound... too much like Londinium is in novels... Oh! Sorry! Don't let me distract you.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: If you want to investigate, it'll probably be hard to ask on any of these streets.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Might end up like this again, with...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: With gettin' a stink all over me for no reason?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Got off light, haha. You're not that stinky.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Do these residents often have clashes with us soldiers?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Used to just be minor friction, but it's been getting tenser lately.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: It's like you've been hearing. There's been several cases of our soldiers getting targeted in attacks, and it's stretching everyone's nerves close to the limit—
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Could it really be the spectre force... that's weird, they didn't really target ordinary soldiers before.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Spectre... what are you going on about?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: ...Nothin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Speakin' of, that patrol just now callin' the people here 'Tara rabble'—
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hold on, don't—don't just say that out loud here! They'll be eyeing us again... What, are you hoping to take away even more rotten veg?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Ah... gotcha. Are they really not Victorians?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Of course they're Victorians.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I'm gettin' more and more lost here.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Some people would choose another word, yeah, the one you've been hearing—Tarans, that's their identity.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You have both the locals themselves who would call them that, as well as a decent portion of the soldiers.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Now that you put a fine point on it, I've heard the term before.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: In novels?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: In history textbooks.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Right. They've always been here.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Over hundreds of years ago, when it wasn't County Hillock yet, and we still hadn't built our nomadic cities, back when it was grass all across the vales as far as the eye could see, this place was their home.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I still remember the legend of the Draco King, Gaeil... was he born right around here?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Tara was the very name of this region back then.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Right. I've read heaps of novels all about the saga of King Gaeil.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: King Gaeil led the Tarans in a conflict against the first Aslan King, but a few years later, he signed a peace treaty along with the ruler of Londinium, didn't he?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: And here I was thinkin', after that, the word Tara just sort of fell away.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Before I came to County Hillock, I thought the same...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: But Victoria's always changing, isn't it? Us Vouivre didn't always live here, but we're all Victorian citizens now.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: If everyone's minds went like that, we'd avoid plenty of conflict.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: No need to let it get you down, though. The whole reason we're here is to uncover the real enemy, stop the clash gettin' any bigger, isn't it?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: So you'd rather not leave, even if it means a headful of rotten cabbage?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Haha, you think I'm bein' a right dunce, don't you?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: No, not at all. Actually, you're amazing to me.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: The patrol just now, I've seen masses of rough attitude like that. It's not like I've never wanted to stop it... but I'm a guard of honor, that's all I am.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: And what's so bad about that? You're a member of Victoria's army too. Course you've got the power to change the situation, if it doesn't sit right with you!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Do... do I really?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Oh, thank you... you're the first person who's ever told me that. Yeah, next time, I'll give it a go...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Oh, yeah, is there anything else I can help you with? Apart from picking these leaves off you... after all, I don't want to see this conflict boil over either.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Let me think... d'you have any local friends you ken? I want to ask whereabouts Damian Barry usually went.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Friends I've got... Saoirse might know something.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Give me a way to keep in touch, and I'll visit the newspaper in a moment. Don't think the Sergeant Major would mind if I'm missing today...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Skamandros.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Colonel.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I once saw your father—over twenty years ago, at a ball the Duke of Caster was holding. Of course, I was still a bottom-rung guard then, so all I had was a glimpse from afar at the White Wolf Count of legend.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Not long after, I heard a deformed feathered reptile struck illness into him at a Londinium beastlife garden, and he quickly took leave from the aristocratic circles.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Ever since, he hasn't taken a step beyond his manor at Portsmouth City.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Is your father still in fine spirits?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Thank you for your concern, and I hope reminiscing over these years-old affairs hasn't eaten up too much of your precious time. After all, meeting with you doesn't prove easy.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You don't resemble your father.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: As is clear, my father did not have the opportunity to serve for the Empire's Army like you or I do.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Considering the theft of these military Originium goods couldn't possibly relate to him, maybe we don't have a need for probing further into his later life.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: One's background decides what kind of person one becomes. Would you agree with that, Skamandros?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I believe one has the right to choose one's own future.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Listen to that. How befitting an answer of your status.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: The progeny of the Aslans' aide, first-class honors from the Royal Guard Academy, a Londinium army upstart—of course you believe you can change anything and everything.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I have no intent to make any such changes, Colonel. You don't need to worry about our squad potentially impacting your command over County Hillock...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: For a joke, I don't find that humorous at all. You can't be so arrogant as to think I'd occupy myself with a paltry little lieutenant?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I've met people like you plenty. Always all braggadocio, skin-deep, and superficial. I deigned to meet you because I wanted to tell you this—
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Don't interfere in things beyond your ken.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I cannot agree to that.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The orders we received were to ascertain the lost Originium products' whereabouts.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: If you just stay still and wait where you ought to, then before long, you may accomplish your duty and return to Londinium with all the ostentation you'd like.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I don't need that ostentation of yours, and Victoria needs it even less.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I'm not in the routine of reporting back with a hurriedly lopped-off head, sans trial.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hahah! You're telling me I've a disregard for human life—and you believe those people are truly innocent? How ridiculous!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Just ten days ago, three of our soldiers were murdered in cold blood. James Cohen, Robert Boris, and Jeremy Brown.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: When Cohen's wife wrote to tell him she was with a second child, she had no idea that her husband had had a hole gruesomely blown in his head.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Boris could've left this place once midsummer passed. He mentioned he'd go back to continue his family's clothiers after his retirement.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: And Brown, he was a bright young student just a year ago, and not even twenty when he died!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I give my profound regrets for their sacrifice.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Regrets! Hah, what weightless rhetoric, just like every word that wafts out of your mouth.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: This is exactly why all of us want to catch hold of the assassinators. Colonel, on this matter, we have held unanimous positions throughout.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No one else but that Tara rabble killed them. We've uncovered two already, but I know there are still more tucked in the background.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Fifteen days ago, our barracks suffered an explosive attack at three simultaneous places. An according fifteen soldiers lost their lives. The craters and the spilled blood of our own still lie where they were.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Twenty-one days ago, our resupply transport group were ambushed outside the distribution sector in the outskirts north, and the whole detachment together with their goods disappeared without a trace. Do you feel there is any possibility they would still be alive?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: This is only the last month's events, to boot. You know nothing at all of the losses we've long since endured.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: These incidents you mention all sound very in line with the spectre force's MO.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: In the past half a year, Londinium has continually received reports from more than ten different counties, logging up to hundreds of homicide, looting and property damage cases.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: After every offence, they swiftly conceal their tracks, and all connected personnel who've seen them are caught in assassinations before they can contact us.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We've been able to obtain exceedingly little information so far.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: That is why the lead before us is so crucial.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We still don't know the spectre force's goal in haunting County Hillock, but I believe that they are our mutual enemy.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Colonel, if we and the barracks can cooperate, and uncover the spectre force here, it'll be of great benefit to County Hillock and Victoria as a whole.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hmph. You still understand nothing at all. You treat the atrocities before you as just another case to win you a medal.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: But you're wrong, soldier. This is not some case, and no such true culprit exists. This is a war, and it is between us and them, a war ongoing for decades, even for centuries.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: You call them a spectre force, but do you know what that name signifies?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Who is the enemy we've been confronting all this time? Well?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: It's a ghost! It's a phantom drifting over this city, an apparition that echoes in the heads of Taran morons, it is a life-in-spirit ghost!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: And that spectre speaks a different language to us, willfully distorts the history molded by our ancestors' hands, has delusions that by the body of our city it will one day return to life!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Are you saying that a great amount of the local populace are supporters of the spectre force?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Great amount? Supporters? No, you're mistaken. They are one single whole.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Have you ever read this anthology of poetry?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Seamus Williams. His poems have some fame in Londinium too.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: This is their very compilation of bare-faced lies about Victoria. In their depictions, they have their own language; they are this land's natural owners.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Still, Victoria can tolerate the mindsets of authors who come from differing cultural backgrounds.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No one would assume a dreamer's fantasy as their truth. Not unless that dream mentioned taking up a hatchet. Not unless it was about wanting to cut our heads off.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: I still keep this book of an idiot's sleeptalk so that the bloodstains upon it always remind me—
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: If one lives on Victoria's land, yet refuses to give one's own name in Victorian, then one is no longer a Victorian, but an enemy and a menace to this country's safety!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: You... you executed the holder of this anthology? Simply because they...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Reporting in!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Speak.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Command has lost contact with 9th Defence and 13th Defence after they were attacked.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: 5th, 7th and 10th Defence each sent vanguards ASAP to the scene, and did not find traces of the enemy.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: What of our own?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: They... gave their lives.
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Did you hear that, Skamandros?
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Right as you were seeing fit to tell me sympathetic rubbish to the enemy, we once again saw outstanding soldiers die at their hands!
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: If that's gotten through your head, then kindly eject yourself from my office. I still have genuine work awaiting me.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton

attributes.content: Fine. Very fine. I have my own work to do too.
attributes.name: Horn
